result.execSummary:
The defendant Rex Lee Cosby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $243.00   Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rex Lee Cosby

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rex Lee Cosby in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  10:02 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  State moved to amend to Disorderly conduct 947.01(1).  Court questions defendant as to plea questionnaire. Court grants motion to amend to 947.01(1).   Defendant entered plea of NC to amended charge.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Victim addressed the court requests he read the VIS.

COURT:  Costs of $443.00 fiven 60 deays to pay and 72 days credit time served

Defendant Rex Lee Cosby in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Rex Lee Cosby in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  10:08 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Hoffman addressed the Court opinion is defendant can assist in his own defense.  Court makes stmt - defendant is competent to proceed.   Atty Hoffman requests signature bond be re-instated.  State does not object.  Court grants bond is re-instated.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rex Lee Cosby in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is ready to proceed - 
DR  Donna Lee Minter sworn/testifies direct - not competent to proceed at this time.  EXH#1 Doctors Report;  cross.
DEF counsel requests outpatient facility.
Court finds DEF is not Comptent to stand trial, cannot refuse medications, and Enter Inpatient Treatment facility to be treated until competency restored up to 12 months.
Once a bed is available DEF to be transported to Inpatient facility by Sheriff Dept. Joe Bodo to make arrangements for Bed and Facility.  Review scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Rex Lee Cosby in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is in receipt of report from examiner. Report finds Mr Cosby is not competent at this time. Mr Cosby believes he is competent and would like to proceed. Dr Minter not available until after 7/20/15 for testimony. Adjourn competency hearing to 8/6/15. Parties agreed off the record that Dr Minter may appear by phone.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Rex Lee Cosby in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   SIBS $1,000 no special Conditions.   Modify date of offence to April 16, 2015 from April 17, 2015, COurt amended.   Attorney Hoffman requests competency examination hearing, attny will file motion.  DA suggests court just approve upon receiving Attny Motion.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
